title.value: Accompanying patients in clinical oncology teams: Reported activities and perceived effects
title.justification: The title is clearly indicated at the beginning of the paper as 'ORIGINAL ARTICLE' followed by the actual title 'Accompanying patients in clinical oncology teams: Reported activities and perceived effects'.
title.quote: Accompanying patients in clinical oncology teams: Reported activities and perceived effects

extractions.description: This paper explores the role of Accompanying Patients (APs) in oncology settings in Quebec, Canada. It investigates the activities performed by APs and the perceived effects of their integration into clinical teams, both on patients and healthcare professionals. The study focuses on how APs help cancer patients by providing emotional, informational, cognitive, and navigational support, aiming to empower patients in their care. Methods include qualitative interviews and focus groups conducted over a two-year period.

type.justification: The paper reports on a qualitative study based on interviews and focus groups with APs, indicating that it is an empirical study involving data collection and analysis of real-world experiences.
type.quote: Methods: A qualitative study based on semistructured interviews and focus groups was conducted with APs at the beginning of their intervention (T1) and 2 years afterwards (T2).

name.justification: The primary focus is on clinical oncology and integrating patient advisors into clinical teams, indicating a healthcare research field.
name.quote: The PAROLE‚ÄêOnco programme aimed to integrate APs into the clinical teams of four different healthcare establishments in Quebec, Canada.

name.justification: The paper is centered around oncology teams and cancer patient support, showing that one of its main subfields is oncology.
name.quote: APs accompany patients in healthcare teams to improve the experience of cancer patients undergoing treatments (e.g., radiotherapy, chemotherapy, surgery), mostly for breast cancer.

name.justification: The focus of the paper includes patient support and peer support systems, as it discusses the role and effects of APs, who are peer advisors, in patient care.
name.quote: To date, the perspective of APs directly involved at a clinical level has been poorly documented... on the patients and on the clinical team.
